Name: Require training for record access officers or other appropriate staff.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring training for record access officers or other appropriate staff.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. Chapter one of title seven of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by the addition of a new section, 7-111, to read as follows:
§7-111.  Records training.  The corporation counsel shall be required to establish a training program, to be held on a regular schedule, but at least annually, for all City agency records access officers and any appropriate agency staff responsible for servicing agency records, concerning all legal requirements, including article 6 of the new york state public officers law, for providing public access to agency records.  Such training shall be designed to ensure the full compliance with all legal requirements enabling the public timely and efficient access to agency records. 
§2.   This local law shall take effect immediately.
